commit.message:
Rearrange code to allow SHA1 to default to origin HEAD

This allows you to omit the --sha1 parameter even if the current
directory isn't the repository, and fallback to whatever the remote HEAD
is (i.e. usually master)

pr_info.title: Run an arbitrary app for every commit
pr_info.body: This PR adds a new CLI app to Serf that will monitor a serf-server and run an executable on every new SHA1 it encounters.

pr_info.title: Build Project CLI app
pr_info.body:
This PR adds a new CLI app, `serf-build`, which will clone a repo at a specific commit and build it

## TODO:

- [x] Set up cloning
- [x] Actually build the project
- [ ] ~~Copy off artifacts~~ Let's do artifacts in a separate PR

pr_info.title: Status API
pr_info.body: Post to the GitHub Status API

pr_info.title: Enable cloning of private repos
pr_info.body: Use tokens to clone repos when asked for auth

pr_info.title: Clean workdirs
pr_info.body: This PR adds a new app that will mop up old work directories so we won’t run out of disk space

commit.message: Make workdir paths shorter to avoid MAX_PATH

pr_info.title: Fix miscellaneous Windows bugs
pr_info.body: Ensure we can find build commands in PATH, fix workdir being too long

pr_info.title: Build queue optimization / cancellation
pr_info.body:
This PR fixes the naive behavior of the original build-every-ref behavior, which was vulnerable to the following super common scenario:

1. We poll for changes, find 1 changed ref
1. We kick off a single build and wait for it to complete
1. In the meantime, a bunch of refs change
1. Even though we possibly have capacity to run another build, we don't, because we're still running that single build

Instead, we move to a system where we're polling at a constant interval and queuing builds as-required. In addition, we move to canceling builds for outdated SHA1s (i.e. if we're mid-build then that ref changes, we want to just forget about the old build and move on).

Because node.js doesn't correctly use Job APIs (i.e. grandchild processes don't get killed when the parent gets killed), we create a shim executable on Windows called Jobber that will group all of its children together and allow them to be terminated at once

pr_info.title: Create a per-build temp directory
pr_info.body: Set up a temp directory for builds and trash that directory once we successfully build (leave it around if it fails for debugging).

pr_info.title: Build Artifacts
pr_info.body: This PR creates an API for build discoverers to return artifact directories, then push up those files to the build output Gist

pr_info.title: When parameters aren't provided, try really hard to find them
pr_info.body: This PR tries to fill in parameters to the CLI apps with reasonable defaults - for example, if I run `surf-build` in my project dir, it's probably a good guess that I want to build my project at the current SHA1

pr_info.title: Fix node-git tests
pr_info.body: Fix our incorrect refspec rigging which makes the test runner stop randomly failing

pr_info.title: Create a basic status page
pr_info.body:
This PR creates a status page that lets you see the currently polling build clients
